RmMutableMatrix< T >::Operator2D< T > Class Template Reference

Provides mechanism for achieving a two-dimensional operator[] shorthand, such as in my2dArray[x][y]. More...

#include <RmMutableMatrix.h>

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 Operator2D (const RmMutableMatrix< T > *v, int x)
 The constant version of Operator2D().
 Operator2D (RmMutableMatrix< T > *v, int x)
 Stores the reference to the matrix for which the first dimension [x] is being specified, as well as that x-value, so that an adjacent [y], and thus subsequent call to operator[](), will be able to pass the request on to RmMutableMatrix::valueAt().
const T & operator[] (int y) const
 The const version of operator[](), which implies the matrix cannot be resized.
T & operator[] (int y)
 Makes a call to RmMutableMatrix::valueAt() using the previously retained x-value and the newly provided y-value.

Detailed Description

template<class T>
template<class T>
class RmMutableMatrix< T >::Operator2D< T >

Provides mechanism for achieving a two-dimensional operator[] shorthand, such as in my2dArray[x][y].

Stores the reference to the matrix for which the first dimension [x] is being specified, as well as that x-value, so that an adjacent [y], and thus subsequent call to operator[](), will be able to pass the request on to RmMutableMatrix::valueAt().

template<class T>
template<class T>
T& RmMutableMatrix< T >::Operator2D< T >::operator[] (  int  y  )  [inline]
 

Makes a call to RmMutableMatrix::valueAt() using the previously retained x-value and the newly provided y-value.

Parameters:
y the row of the matrix, where a negative value expands it northward, and a positive value beyond its current bounds expands it southward
